intro: Caraguata melinonis, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while its fruits are small berries that turn red when ripe. The plant contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals.
